concise_definition: n. 拐杖, 依赖物, 借口

definitions.explanation_en: A physical support device, typically made of wood or metal, used to help a person with a leg injury or disability walk by transferring weight from the legs to the upper body.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种物理辅助工具，通常由木头或金属制成，用于帮助腿部受伤或残疾的人行走，通过将体重从腿部转移到上半身来提供支撑。
definitions.example_en: After his surgery, he needed crutches to get around for several weeks.
definitions.example_cn: 手术后，他需要拐杖辅助行走数周。

definitions.explanation_en: Something relied upon for support or assistance, especially when lacking the ability or confidence to function independently; often used metaphorically to describe psychological or emotional dependencies.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在缺乏独立能力或信心时所依赖的支撑物，常用于隐喻，形容心理或情感上的依赖。
definitions.example_en: For many people, social media has become a crutch to avoid real human connection.
definitions.example_cn: 对许多人来说，社交媒体已成为逃避真实人际交往的依赖物。

definitions.explanation_en: An excuse or justification used to defend or explain away behavior, especially when it is irrational or inadequate.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用来为某种行为辩护或开脱的借口，尤其当该行为非理性或不充分时。
definitions.example_en: His constant lateness wasn't due to traffic—it was just a crutch to avoid responsibility.
definitions.example_cn: 他总是迟到并不是因为交通堵塞，而只是逃避责任的借口。

comparison.analysis: “Support”（支持）是一个更广泛、更中性的词，可指任何形式的帮助或支撑，包括情感、经济或物理层面。而 “crutch” 带有负面或依赖性含义，暗示这种支持是临时的、非健康的，或阻碍了独立发展。
“Aid”（援助）通常指积极、有益的帮助，常用于正式或人道主义语境（如医疗援助）。而 “crutch” 强调一种被动依赖，甚至可能延缓康复或成长，带有贬义色彩。
“Excuse”（借口）与 “crutch” 在隐喻义上相近，但 “excuse” 更侧重于为错误行为找理由，而 “crutch” 更强调一种长期的心理依赖或惯性依赖，不一定是故意撒谎，而是一种无意识的逃避机制。
